metadata.title: CVE-2020-0444 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In audit_free_lsm_field of auditfilter.c, there is a possible bad kfree dueto a logic error in audit_data_to_entry. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-150693166References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-178-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.70').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~14.04.1').
